Posts.Title: US before mammogram?? Rowdymomma Spag

Posts.Content: Rowdymomma wrote: So a few weeks ago my left breast started hurting. Didn't think much of it as I just started my period. I don't normally have breast pain but still thought it was from my period. While I was changing about 3 days after it started hurting I noticed a red spot above my nipple. I proceeded to do a check and thought I felt a small pea sized lump near my chest wall. The area was extremely sore. Shortly after I had a rash on breast but that went away in a few days. Also started having pain in armpit. Had to wait for Dr appt but armpit hurt quite a bit, redness kind of went away and just over all left breast felt different. Anyways Dr sent me for a diagnostic mammogram and u/s on left breast. I am 36yrs old and never had a mammogram before. So this morning was my appt and they did the u/s first because I was only 36 and if needed they would do a mammogram. Well when the tech was doing u/s she took a lot of pics, at least to me but then she checked my left armpit because of the pain I have been having there. I noticed she measured a couple of masses which I assume were my lymph nodes? She finishes up, then goes to see if they want a mamm done too. They do so I went and had that done. They only did 2 images though and I though diagnostic was more than that? The first one didn't hurt but the 2nd one hurt a ton. My armpit was jammed up in the corner of the plate and it just hurt. Anyways, my questions are. 1. Why u/s before mammogram? 2. Is it normal for them to measure lymph nodes? I have no known history of bc in family. Thank you ladies! I am hoping I can get results tomorrow and not have to go the weekend wondering. I had this done in a hospital so not sure when radiologist will take a look at tests. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: US before mammogram?? Rowdymomma Spag
